nodes.name: Draco Malfoy
nodes.Note: This wand passed into the possession of Harry Potter after the Skirmish at Malfoy Manor in 1998 until Harry came into possession of the Elder Wand and mended his first wand.

nodes.name: Fleur Delacour
nodes.Note: In this wand the core is a hair from Fleur's grandmother, who was a Veela.

nodes.name: Harry Potter
nodes.Note: Brother to Voldemort's wand — the core tail feathers are both from Fawkes; broken in December 1997 while fleeing from Godric's Hollow;[22] repaired with the Elder Wand in May 1998.

nodes.name: Hermione Granger
nodes.Note: This wand was confiscated when the trio was captured by Snatchers in 1998.

nodes.name: Lucius Malfoy
nodes.Note: This wand was kept in a snake-headed walking stick that Lucius carried; 'borrowed' by Lord Voldemort and destroyed by Harry Potter's wand during the Battle of the Seven Potters in 1997.

nodes.name: Minerva McGonagall
nodes.Note: This wand was most likely purchased from Ollivanders in 1947 when she was eleven almost twelve.

nodes.name: Neville Longbottom
nodes.Note: This wand was nice for Charm work.

nodes.name: Quirinus Quirrell
nodes.Note: This wand was nice for Charm work.

nodes.name: Ronald Weasley
nodes.Note: Purchased with his father's winnings from a Daily Prophet draw. Taken from him by Snatchers and replaced with Peter Pettigrew's wand.

nodes.name: Tom Riddle
nodes.Note: This wand is brother to Harry Potter's wand — the core tail feathers are both from Fawkes.

links.Note: The Elder Wand, one of the Deathly Hallows. Also known as the Deathstick and the Wand of Destiny.
This wand is described as 'unyielding;' passed into the possession of Hermione Granger after the Skirmish at Malfoy Manor in 1998.
This wand was 'pleasantly springy'; hair from particularly fine male unicorn (seventeen hands high), which nearly gored Mr Ollivander with its horn after he plucked its tail hair.
This wand was 'pleasantly springy'; hair from particularly fine male unicorn (seventeen hands high), which nearly gored Mr Ollivander with its horn after he plucked its tail hair.
Celestina Warbeck's wand is mentioned in the lyrics of the title track of her best-selling album, You Stole My Cauldron but You Can't Have my Heart.
This wand is described as 'unusually short;' broken by a centaur's hoof in June 1996 in the Forbidden Forest
This wand passed into the possession of Harry Potter after the Skirmish at Malfoy Manor in 1998 until Harry came into possession of the Elder Wand and mended his first wand.
In this wand the core is a hair from Fleur's grandmother, who was a Veela.
Brother to Voldemort's wand — the core tail feathers are both from Fawkes; broken in December 1997 while fleeing from Godric's Hollow;[22] repaired with the Elder Wand in May 1998.
This wand was confiscated when the trio was captured by Snatchers in 1998.
This wand was kept in a snake-headed walking stick that Lucius carried; 'borrowed' by Lord Voldemort and destroyed by Harry Potter's wand during the Battle of the Seven Potters in 1997.
This wand was most likely purchased from Ollivanders in 1947 when she was eleven almost twelve.
This wand was nice for Charm work.
